sec.title: Winches for operating a rig on slopes
sec.p: A winch shall be installed on rigs intended to operate and travel on slopes with a gradient angle higher than 20°, to prevent the rig from sliding down the slope. For those winches, the following requirements apply.

sec.p: Flanges on drums shall be designed to extend at least two rope diameters beyond the outer wrap of rope in all operating conditions. In specific installations where this is not feasible, other means shall be taken in order to prevent the rope to be spooled off the drum, like a mechanical stop or other devices.
Winches for free fall operation shall not be used.
The braking capacity of the winch shall not be less than 1,2 times the pulling force but not exceed 1,6 times the pulling force.
The wire rope safety factor shall not be less than 3.
The application of a winch shall not be included as a support in the stability calculation.
